Class Solution

  • java.lang.Object
    • Solution

  • public class Solution
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Solution is used to store a (partial) solution to the game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Solution(int width, int height)
      Constructor.
      Solution(Solution other)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
      returns true if and only the parameter other is referencing an instance of a Solution which is the ``same'' as this instance of Solution (its board as the same values and it is completed to the same degree)
      boolean finish()
      this method attempts to finish the board for an all OFF board.
      boolean finish(GameModel model)
      this method attempts to finish the board for for a game in the state passed as Game Model It assumes that the Solution was built with a series of setNext on which stillPossible was always true for that game.
      int getSize()
      returns the number of selections in the solution
      boolean isReady()
      returns true if the solution has been entirely specified
      boolean isSuccessful()
      returns true if the solution is completely specified and is indeed working, that is, if it will bring a board of the specified dimensions from being entirely ``off'' to being entirely ``on''.
      boolean isSuccessful(GameModel model)
      returns true if the solution is completely specified and is indeed working, that is, if it will bring a board of the specified dimensions from the state currently in game model to being entirely ``on''.
      void setNext(boolean nextValue)
      specifies the ``next'' value of the solution.
      boolean stillPossible(boolean nextValue)
      this method ensure that adding nextValue at the currentIndex does not make the current solution impossible for an all OFF board.
      boolean stillPossible(boolean nextValue, GameModel model)
      this method ensure that adding nextValue at the currentIndex does not make the current solution impossible for the game in the state passed at parameter.
      java.lang.String toString()
      returns a string representation of the solution

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Solution

        public Solution(int width,
                int height)
        Constructor. Creates an instance of Solution for a board of size widthxheight. That solution does not have any board position value explicitly specified yet.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the board
        height - the height of the board

      • Solution

        public Solution(Solution other)
        Constructor. Creates an instance of Solution wich is a copy of the instance received as parameter. The copy is a deep-copy, except for the game model, which is shared between the newly created instance and the instance references as parameter
        Parameters:
        other - Instance of solution to copy

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        returns true if and only the parameter other is referencing an instance of a Solution which is the ``same'' as this instance of Solution (its board as the same values and it is completed to the same degree)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - referenced object to compare

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        returns true if the solution has been entirely specified
        Returns:
        true if the solution is fully specified

      • setNext

        public void setNext(boolean nextValue)
        specifies the ``next'' value of the solution. The first call to setNext specifies the value of the board location (1,1), the second call specifies the value of the board location (1,2) etc. If setNext is called more times than there are positions on the board, an error message is printed out and the call is ignored.
        Parameters:
        nextValue - the boolean value of the next position of the solution

      • isSuccessful

        public boolean isSuccessful()
        returns true if the solution is completely specified and is indeed working, that is, if it will bring a board of the specified dimensions from being entirely ``off'' to being entirely ``on''.
        Returns:
        true if the solution is completely specified and works

      • isSuccessful

        public boolean isSuccessful(GameModel model)
        returns true if the solution is completely specified and is indeed working, that is, if it will bring a board of the specified dimensions from the state currently in game model to being entirely ``on''.
        Parameters:
        model - reference to the GameModel capturing the current state of the game
        Returns:
        true if the solution is completely specified and works

      • stillPossible

        public boolean stillPossible(boolean nextValue)
        this method ensure that adding nextValue at the currentIndex does not make the current solution impossible for an all OFF board. It assumes that the Solution was built with a series of setNext on which stillPossible was always true.
        Parameters:
        nextValue - The boolean value to add at currentIndex
        Returns:
        true if the board is not known to be impossible (which does not mean that the board is possible!)

      • stillPossible

        public boolean stillPossible(boolean nextValue,
                             GameModel model)
        this method ensure that adding nextValue at the currentIndex does not make the current solution impossible for the game in the state passed at parameter. It assumes that the Solution was built with a series of setNext on which stillPossible was always true for a game in that state.
        Parameters:
        nextValue - The boolean value to add at currentIndex
        model - reference to the GameModel capturing the current state of the game
        Returns:
        true if the board is not known to be impossible (which does not mean that the board is possible!)

      • finish

        public boolean finish()
        this method attempts to finish the board for an all OFF board. It assumes that the Solution was built with a series of setNext on which stillPossible was always true. It cannot be called if the board can be extended with both true and false and still be possible.
        Returns:
        true if the all off board can be finished. the Solution is also completed

      • finish

        public boolean finish(GameModel model)
        this method attempts to finish the board for for a game in the state passed as Game Model It assumes that the Solution was built with a series of setNext on which stillPossible was always true for that game. It cannot be called if the board can be extended with both true and false and still be possible.
        Parameters:
        model - reference to the GameModel capturing the current state of the game
        Returns:
        true if the all off board can be finished. the Solution is also completed

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        returns the number of selections in the solution
        Returns:
        the number of selections

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        returns a string representation of the solution
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation
